name: Beef and Broccoli
description: A classic Chinese stir-fry dish featuring tender slices of beef and fresh broccoli in a rich, garlicky sauce.
steps: Blanch broccoli florets in boiling water for 2 minutes, then drain.
Marinate beef slices in a mixture of soy sauce, cornstarch, and a little oil.
Heat oil in a wok, add minced garlic, and stir-fry briefly until fragrant.
Add the marinated beef and stir-fry until it starts to brown.
Add broccoli and stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
Pour in a mixture of beef stock, oyster sauce, and a splash of soy sauce, and cook until the sauce thickens.
tips: Slice the beef against the grain for more tenderness.
Make sure the wok is very hot before adding the beef to ensure it sears properly.
Adjust the thickness of the sauce with more or less beef stock or cornstarch.
